text: Jean Charles Léonard de Sismondi (also known as Jean Charles Leonard Simonde de Sismondi) (; 9 May 1773 – 25 June 1842), was a Swiss historian and political economist. == Works == Sismondi is best known for his works on French and Italian history, and his economic ideas. His goals were to promote unemployment insurance, sickness benefits, a progressive tax, regulation of working hours, and a pension scheme. He was also the first to use the term proletariat to describe the working class created under capitalism. ==References== Category:Writers from Geneva Category:Scientists from Geneva Category:1773 births Category:1842 deaths Category:Swiss historians Category:Swiss economists
